content.description: Climb  over a powerful, but short bulge to the vertical face above.
content.location: Right side of the Pink Wall.

content.description: Climb up left of center of the Pink Wall. A short and powerful crux leads up and right to join "Pink Flamingo" at its 3rd bolt. Continue on the route to the anchors.
content.location: Left of the center of the Pink Wall.

content.description: Enjoyable climbing between large holds. Climbs the tall face at the right end of the wall, passing a very cool sloping block down low on the route.
content.location: Right side of the Pink Wall, left of the arete.

content.description: Climbs easy moves to the 3rd bolt. From here climb up and left, encountering the crux almost right away. Continue past small holds and intriguing moves to the top of the wall. Outstanding route, nice movement on good rock, for the area.
content.location: Left side of the Pink Wall.

content.description: Begin climbing off the ledge above and right of "Terror in New York." Climb the slightly overhanging face to a high crux and an enjoyable slab finish.
content.location: Off the ledge at the right side of the Pink Wall.

content.description:
Large edges and pockets lead up and right through steep rock for 3 bolts to the crux which features smaller holds and may require some creative footwork. Once past the crux the angle eases and the holds become better - if you can stay on your feet it should be in the bag.

The steep climbing and fun moves on this route make it a recommended 5.11 route at Echo.
content.location:
This is the 3rd bolt line from the left and shares the first two bolts with the classic

Split Decision

before diverging right.

content.description: Starts on far left side of the pink wall, just right of arete. Climbs the face about 5-10 feet right of the arete with fun varied movement using crimps, pockets and side pulls to a crux near the top. Best to belay from the trail below, on left side of bush (if facing cliff).
content.location: Left side of the Pink Wall.

content.description: Start just to the right of the large bush and climb up and right to the 1st bolt. After clipping this, set up as well as you can for a long span left and the beginning of the crux. A very pumpy route with no real stopper moves after the initial crux.
content.protection: 8 bolts & 2 open shuts. Shares an anchor with Restrain This.

content.description: A tricky sequence off the ground leads to a hard boulder problem on crimps and pockets. After passing the 5th bolt rest up for a high crimp crux and then some fun moves to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts to Shuts. Shares first bolt of Pink Flamingo which branches left.
content.location: Start in the middle of the wall just left of a large pillar. This pillar is off route.

content.description: Start at the top of a boulder; climb up a steep arete with big handholds to a face, and into a dihedral. A few stemming moves lead to the anchors. The crux is right off the ground, the rest is 5.9.
content.location: Middle of Pink Wall - look for a prominent boulder.
